job.title: Software Engineer I
job.description:
Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.
Software Engineer I – St Paul (Little Canada) Tech Center
Join a dynamic and motivated team at Abbott Electrophysiology (EP), developing medical products that set the bar for clinical excellence and efficient workflow. Our products provide cutting edge, advanced software to enable 3D cardiac models which help in diagnosing and treating cardiac disease. As a member of the software development team you will help take these products to the next level and reduce cost, improve quality, increase access. The Software Engineer I contributes to all phases of the software lifecycle, including concept development, requirements, design, implementation, and testing.
Primary Duties And Responsibilities
Write well-designed, testable code
Develop Machine learning capabilities for recognizing and analyzing cardiac images
Work closely with cross-functional teams in Systems and hardware/firmware to develop optimal solutions combining software and embedded software on FPGA’s
Integrate software components into functional software system
Develop graphical user interface components
Develop manual and automated tests for software verification as needed
Develop and maintain documentation to identify design, requirements, and solutions
Utilize your familiarity with all aspects of Software Development Life Cycle and methodologies
Communicate effectively both within immediate team and across the program and business leadership team
Required Qualifications
B.S. in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Systems Engineering, Software Engineering, or related discipline.
Excellent C++/C#/Java knowledge
Preferred
Master’s Degree in Engineering (Computer, Electrical, Computer Systems, or Software), Computer Science, or related discipline / Advanced degree may substitute for up years of experience
2+ months of software engineering design.
Excellent documentation skills
Strong understanding of the hardware/software interface
Experience working in a Linux environment
Experience working in a regulated environment (preferably medical)
Strong oral and written communication skills
Strong interpersonal skills
Software development tool experience such as Perforce, Jira, Jenkins
What We Offer
At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer:
Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance and student loan repayment program
Student Loan Repayment Assistance
Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives, and retirement plans
Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs
Paid time off
401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match
The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities
